# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width 
            result *= "\n"
        end
        
        result *= " $word"
    end
    
    return result[2:end] # Removing the first space character from the start of string
end
```
You can use this function by calling it with a string and the desired width. For example: 

```julia
print(wrap_string("Hello, world! This is a test.", 15))
```
This will output:
```shell
Hello,
world!
This is
a test.
```
As you can see, it wraps the words according to the desired width and adds newline characters between each line.
